estate.translation[0].definitions[0].def: all of someone’s property and money, especially everything that is left after they die
estate.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The property is part of the deceased’s estate.
estate.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a large area of land in the country, usually with one large house on it and one owner
estate.translation[0].definitions[2].def: an area where houses or buildings of a similar type have all been built together in a planned way
estate.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a large piece of land in the country, usually with one large house on it and one owner
estate.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The estate consists of the main villa, several outbuildings and barns, a swimming pool, a farm house and an old mill.
estate.translation[1].definitions[1].def: land used for growing a particular crop, especially tea, coffee, or rubber
estate.translation[1].definitions[2].def: an area of land with factories and offices
estate.translation[1].definitions[3].def: when someone owns all or part of a piece of land, and any buildings on it, or has a right to use it
estate.translation[1].definitions[4].def: all of someone’s money and property, especially everything that is left after they die
estate.translation[1].definitions[4].exa: In her original will, she left her whole estate to her only son.
